subject: RE: [junit] execute a single testXx method from text-based test runner?
msgSnippet: Hi Sam, How about using TestSuite? Use a TestSuite and just add that one particular test method to the TestSuite. Cheers, Veny ... From: orionlee
messageBody:
Hi Sam,

How about using TestSuite? Use a TestSuite and just add that one particular
test method to the TestSuite.

Cheers,

Veny

-----Original Message-----
From: orionlee [mailto:orionlee@...]
Sent: Saturday, January 31, 2004 5:28 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] execute a single testXx method from text-based test
runner?


hi,

From time to time during debug, I only want to execute a single testXx
method rather than the entire Test class.

The current text-based test runner does not seem to provide the
functionality.

I have two questions:
1. is there some well-accepted recommendation on dealing with such a
scenario?

2. if the answer to (1) is no, it seems that the text-based test
runner can be (somewhat) easily enhanced to accomodate the case (I
have done that for my own use). What is the process to feedback such
enhancement back to junit base?

Thanks!

- sam
